title: Philip Morris Indonesia Tax Heat; Illinois' Long Gambling Odds
itunes:title: Philip Morris Indonesia Tax Heat; Illinois' Long Gambling Odds
description:
In this week’s Bloomberg Intelligence radio show, Kenneth Shea discusses Philip Morris’s prospects in Indonesia amid higher cigarette taxes, Fernando Valle dissects the oil-price fallout from the Saudi Aramco attacks and Brian Egger warns that Illinois may be falling behind Midwest peers in sports wagering. London-based financials analyst Jonathan Tyce breaks down HKEX’s uphill climb for LSE, and European currency strategist Audrey Childe-Freeman gives her view of why a 25-bp Federal Reserve interest rate cut won’t weaken the dollar.

Bloomberg Intelligence provides in-depth research and data on more than 2,000 companies and 130 industries. The BI show first broadcasts at noon New York time on Saturdays and over the weekend.

Hosts: Alix Steel and Paul Sweeney

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
